title: Terrorist hideout unearthed in J&K’s Doda
content: A pistol, its three magazines and six rounds and 25 rounds of AK assault rifle were recovered from the hideout

title: Fadnavis announces major infrastructure boost under HAM Phase-1 project
content: The Chief Minister added that the initiative has surpassed expectations, achieving 5% more progress in record time under the State’s 100 day program

title: Indian-origin woman charged with slitting son’s throat after Disneyland vacation
content: She faces a maximum sentence of 26 years to life if convicted on all charges, a statement from the Office of the District Attorney, Orange County, California said on March 21, 2025

title: Pakistan authorities hand over bodies of two missing persons from J&K to Indian officials at Kaman post
content: The authorities from the Indian side took the matter up with officials across the LoC, who eventually retrieved both the bodies from the Jhelum river

title: Assam State board paper leak: All Class 11 exams cancelled, fresh dates to be announced soon
content: Earlier, the Higher Secondary first year Mathematics paper, scheduled on March 21, of the Assam State School Education Board was leaked, forcing the authorities to cancel the examinations and lodge a police complaint

title: Bangladesh request for Muhammad Yunus-PM Modi meeting under consideration, Parliamentary panel told
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar was also learnt to have told the meeting that SAARC was inactive because of Pakistan's approach and thus India is trying to strengthen BIMSTEC

title: Will not attend 'Iftaar' hosted by Nitish because of Waqf stance: Bihar Muslim body
content: The Imarat Shariah, which claims to have followers across Bihar, Jharkhand and Odisha, shared a copy of the letter in response to the invitation for the 'Iftaar' that is to be held at the Chief Minister's residence on Sunday

title: 'Nothing wrong with Nitish Kumar': Manjhi defends Bihar CM amid national anthem row
content: Nitish Kumar has been under attack from the opposition for allegedly "disrespecting" the national anthem at an event in Patna

title: India must necessarily develop broad, diverse set of energy relationships: Jaishankar
content: Jaishankar also said that after decades of hearing the virtues of globalisation, the world today is grappling with the reality of industrial policies, export controls and tariff wars

title: Indian national detained in Qatar; embassy extending assistance
content: The charges against Amit Gupta, said to be a senior employee of an Indian IT firm, is not immediately known

title: Irish Education Minister looks for collaboration and strengthening ties with Indian institutions
content: The Irish Minister also underlined the existing significant presence of Indian students and workers in the country.

title: Triple-negative breast cancer vaccine to be developed in Kerala: Minister
content: Health Minister Veena George also said that 24 hospitals across the State had been designated for cancer treatment

title: Wayanad becomes first district in State to issue health cards for sickle-cell patients
content: Health cards would be made available to sickle-cell patients through their respective medical offices

title: WB CM leaves for the United Kingdom for a week-long visit
content: Mamata Banerjee will deliver a speech at the Kellogg College at Oxford University on the topic “Social Development: Empowerment of Women and Children”.

title: Head severed, hands cut off, legs bent back: Autopsy reveals savagery of Meerut killing
content: Doctors who conducted the post-mortem reported that Rajput was stabbed in the heart with extreme force thrice, indicating a sustained and violent attack

title: Why is uploading voting data a challenge?
content: Why does the Election Commission of India find it difficult to disclose absolute numbers of booth-wise votes cast in elections? What do the Opposition and activists want? What are the two parts of Form 17C? What are some of the discrepancies that have been pointed out?

title: Fugitive businessman Mehul Choksi living in Belgium's Antwerp: report
content: The report claimed that Choksi gave misleading and fabricated documentation to obtain residency in Belgium to escape extradition to India

title: Rafale-M operations, anti-submarine warfare in focus during Indo-France naval exercise
content: French Rear Admiral Jacques Mallard highlighted the positive influence of the exercise on bilateral naval cooperation and defence tactics.

title: What does a terror group branding entail?
content: Why has India demanded a ban on the Sikhs for Justice? Which are the countries it is looking to for support?

title: A judge never writes a judgment to please or displease anybody, says former Chief Justice Chandrachud
content: A judge gives a verdict based on where the balance of law and justice lies in a case, he says and adds that in a democracy, people are entitled to their opinion about judgments

title: DGGI blocks 357 illegal online gaming websites; attaches 2,400 bank accounts
content: GST intelligence officers block 357 illegal offshore gaming websites and caution public against engaging with them

title: Chhattisgarh Govt hopes to attract Maoists with new policy
content: Each surrendered Maoists will receive ₹50,000 as initial financial assistance; additional financial support is provided if they undergo skill training or set up a small business, along with free housing and healthcare

title: T.N. Cyber Crime Wing directs matrimonial sites to verify user IDs
content: Fraudsters exploit matrimonial sites to perpetrate their scams. They create fake profiles on matrimonial sites, target people seeking marriage proposals on those sites

title: Work under way to strengthen SWDs and lay concrete roads
content: Officials say the ₹15-cr. work includes the construction of storm-water drains, and widening of the stretches near Arunachaleshwara temple to 12 m; the entire work will be completed in six months

title: In St. Antony alone, we trust
content: Tamil Nadu and Sri Lankan fishermen who consider each other brethren have, nevertheless, for decades seen the other as inimical to their profession and welfare. As they come together to the contentious mass of rocks at Katchatheevu for their annual pilgrimage this year, they realise how difficult a practical solution that will appease all is, frustrated by political compulsions that make it impossible. They leave with the hope that only St. Antony, whose festival they had come to attend, can show the way. C. Palanivel Rajan listens in as they spar with each other

title: Cash row: Supreme Court makes public inquiry report by Delhi HC Chief Justice
content: CJI constitutes three-member committee to conduct inquiry; Delhi Chief Justice’s inquiry report on Justice Yashwant Varma uploaded online; Justice Varma denies allegations, calls for deeper probe

title: VMC council passes deficit budget of ₹145 crore for 2025-26
content: TDP Floor Leader N. Balaswamy said the budget would only increase burden on the people because there is a difference of ₹145.05 crore between the estimated expenditure and income

title: Fertilizers committee warns against under-funding of nutrient subsidy schemes
content: The report also notes the improvement in selected crop growth with modern fertilizers; urges the Centre to develop domestic production capabilities.

title: Five-day long Bihar Diwas celebrations begin at Patna’s Gandhi Maidan
content: Various government departments have set up stalls providing information about ongoing government schemes

title: India was aware of anti-Hasina wave but could not interfere, says Jaishankar
content: EAM briefs Members of Parliament on India’s foreign policy with regard to Bangladesh, Myanmar, says ‘SAARC is not off the table’

title: Justice Unplugged: Public faith in the judiciary is eroding, says former CJI Ramana
content: Justice Ramana (retd.) noted that the judiciary does not adequately reflect the country’s diversity; he emphasised that a more representative bench would enrich jurisprudence

title: Justice Unplugged: Laws should keep pace with changes in business practices, say experts
content: Experts discuss challenges in balancing privacy and data processing, emphasising the need for laws to keep pace with business changes

title: Southern states are punished for achieving targets, say Kerala CM and Karnataka Deputy CM
content: Let us channel the defiance of Periyar, the statesmanship of Annadurai, and the fire of Basavanna to reclaim the vision of India as a union of equal States, says D.K. Shivakumar

title: BRS leader Rama Rao proposes delimitation based on fiscal contribution and development
content: Mr. Rao pitches 36% representation in Parliament for the Southern States, says South should not be penalised for doing exceptionally well in political, economic and other indicators

title: Odisha Vigilance arrests govt. employees for embezzling ₹3.5 crore from State welfare funds
content: Two employees had diverted welfare funds into online betting game by forging signatures of Sarpanch and lost massive fund meant for villagers

title: After ‘Captain Abhishek’, billboards with ‘Supreme leader Mamata’ surface in Kolkata
content: Posters of ‘Odhinayak Abhishek’ and ‘Sarbadhinayika Mamata’ have come side by side in certain areas, including Jadavpur, sparking political speculation

title: Fine quality rice to enrich midday meal from next academic year: Nadendla Manohar
content: Packing of this variety of rice will be done in boxes at five logistics points in the State and sent to schools directly from there, says the Minister for Food, Civil Supplies and Consumer Affairs

title: NTA extends CUET-UG application date after aspirants report technical glitches
content: The deadline for submitting CUET-UG forms has now been extended by two days, with the revised last date being March 24

title: Symposium on colon cancer trains focus on early diagnosis
content: At ‘Colon Cancer Symposium 2025’, experts discussed various aspects of the disease, its prevention, management and treatment

title: Kannada activists temporarily disrupt Coffee Santhe
content: According to organisers of the santhe, some activists shouted slogans, pulled down flex boards and standees, and slashed banners written in English. However, the police intervened and things returned to normal in about 20 minutes

title: Telangana and Punjab CMs chime in with opposition to delimitation
content: ‘The south Indian States could not accept the proposed delimitation as it would politically limit the States and punish them for performing well,’ Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy said

title: Kharge slams Modi government over ‘Make in India’ scheme’s unfulfilled promises
content: The BJP govt. has not delivered on the promise to make India a global manufacturing hub, says the Congress chief, citing the state of production and GDP

title: Congress seeks arrest of Punjab Police personnel who assaulted an army officer in Patiala
content: Party leaders seek a probe into the matter, after 12 police personnel allegedly beat up the Colonel and his son over a parking dispute

title: Many parts in Rayalaseema receive light rain
content: Light to moderate rain, accompanied with thunderstorm and lightning, is likely at isolated places across the State until March 25, according to IMD

title: CBI files closure report in Sushant Singh Rajput death case: Officials
content: CBI submits findings on Sushant Singh Rajput case to Mumbai court, considering further probe, closure report filed

title: Calcutta High Court orders that Dalits be allowed entry into temple in Bengal’s Nadia district
content: This is the second time in the last month that authorities in West Bengal had to intervene to help Dalits get equal rights to a place of worship; district judge, police directed to monitor situation closely

title: BJP to hold election for State president on Monday
content: It will be a token election, with a leader already selected by the Central leadership set to file the nomination, say sources

title: Yellow alert for two districts on March 23 as summer rain lashes in Kerala
content: Urumi in Kozhikode received 88.5 mm of rain until 8 p.m. on Saturday, while Udumbannoor in Idukki received 67 mm of rain until 7 p.m. on the same day

title: Sreedharan rules out K-Rail, says CM yet to write to Centre for feasible alternative project
content: Alternative proposal will obviate many of the troubles that K-Rail will give to the people, says the technocrat

title: Use of advanced communication tools in disaster management needed: official
content: Special Chief Secretary R.P. Sisodia reviews preparedness for heatwaves and monsoon season, assesses availability of manpower and equipment

title: CJI forms three-member committee for deeper probe against Justice Varma
content: Huge amounts of cash allegedly found at Justice Varma’s home during a blaze; Delhi CJ asked not to assign him any judicial work; in-house probe is “confidential procedure for institutional credibility” under CJI’s charge

title: Tripura CM chairs meeting with Reliance group for investment in the State
content: Tripura officials proposed working in sectors like IT and tech services, as well as natural gas exploration, fertiliser, ethanol production from bamboo, rubber and agro-based products, food processing, and tourism

title: Tragedy under the heel of a cybercrime crackdown
content: At Alwar’s Teliyabas hamlet in Rajasthan, an early morning raid by police ended with the death of a month-old infant of Meo labourers. Aroon Deep reports on the protests thereafter, and the area that accounts for a larger part of India’s smartphone-based fraud

title: Remedial teaching, retest for students who do not score minimum marks
content: List of students who do not get 30% marks in the written exam in each subject will be prepared and they will be provided with remedial teaching from April 8 to 24

title: From 1 to 32: Ranking every team left in women’s March Madness
content: Which 1-seed got passed by UConn? UCLA or South Carolina for No. 1 overall? We rank the 32 teams that advanced.

title: 'Legend' Calipari leads Razorbacks into Sweet 16
content: John Calipari is heading to the Sweet 16 for the 16th time, guiding the Razorbacks past nemesis Rick Pitino and second-seeded St. John's 75-66 on Saturday to bring his fourth school to the NCAA tournament's second week.

title: Pitino defends benching Luis in loss to Arkansas
content: St. John's coach Rick Pitino defended benching star RJ Luis Jr. for the final 4:56 of Saturday's 75-66 loss to Arkansas.

title: With LeBron back, Lakers lose, eye strong finish
content: The Lakers were whole for the first time in weeks Saturday, but the long-awaited return of LeBron James from a strained left groin couldn't prevent Los Angeles from posting a 146-115 blowout loss to the Chicago Bulls, an effort that dropped them to 43-27.

title: Johnson returns, stars in LSU's 55-point victory
content: Flau'Jae Johnson, who missed the SEC tournament with a right shin injury, wore a compression sleeve over her lower leg in scoring 22 points on Saturday night, as LSU overwhelmed San Diego State 103-48 in the opening round of the women's NCAA tournament.

title: No. 1 Auburn shakes off slow start, doubts in win
content: Top-seeded Auburn shook off a slow first half to put away Creighton in the second and reach the Sweet 16.

title: Hendrickson stuns Steveson to win wrestling title
content: Oklahoma State's Wyatt Hendrickson stunned Olympic gold medalist Gable Steveson 5-4 in the heavyweight final Saturday night at the NCAA men's wrestling championships, which Penn State won for a fourth straight time.

title: Butler shrugs off Miami return: Just 'another game'
content: Jimmy Butler called his return to Miami on Tuesday just "another game," shrugging off the notion of any extra emotions tied to the matchup.

title: Turner, Pacers win after sister's medical issue
content: Under trying circumstances in a win over the Brooklyn Nets, Indiana Pacers center Myles Turner delivered one of his best efforts of the season Saturday. Hours earlier, his sister, Mya, was taken off the court on a stretcher during pregame warmups.

title: Your guide to men's March Madness second round: Results, analysis, keys to Sweet 16
content: Whether you watched all, part or none of Saturday's games -- our team has you covered with what to know.

title: NHL playoff watch: What's at stake in all 14 games on Showdown Saturday
content: Here's what to watch in every matchup. Plus, full playoff projections, draft lottery standings and more.

title: 'An out in three pitches': What the rest of MLB can learn from the Royals' old-school rotation
content: Five guys ... making quality starts ... day in and day out? Sounds like a bygone era. But it worked big-time for the Royals last year. Why isn't everyone else doing it?

title: George Foreman beat time by going from humiliation to vindication
content: Boxing is full of guys who fought past their primes. What Foreman pulled off was something entirely different.

title: Yes, USMNT fans: It's time to worry about the 2026 World Cup
content: The U.S. national team and coach Mauricio Pochettino are running out of time to fix what's wrong before the World Cup -- and there's a lot wrong.

title: Poch: USMNT faces test of 'character' vs. Canada
content: USMNT coach Mauricio Pochettino said that Sunday's third-place game in the Concacaf Nations League against Canada is a match where "we need to show character."

title: Ronaldo: 'No problem' with Højlund's 'Siu' celeb
content: Cristiano Ronaldo said he has "no problem" with Rasmus Højlund performing his famed "Siu" celebration after scoring in Denmark's win over Portugal on Thursday.

title: Ex-France star Ribery: Leg was nearly amputated
content: Former Bayern Munich and France winger Franck Ribery has revealed that he almost had his leg amputated towards the end of his career after surgery on his knee.

title: Wrexham boost promotion hopes with 1-0 win
content: Wrexham made progress in their hunt for automatic promotion from League One on Saturday as they moved into second place with a 1-0 win over 10-man Stockport County.

title: Haaland scores in 5-0 Norway rout to start WCQ
content: Erling Haaland helped Norway make a positive start to its World Cup qualifying campaign by scoring in a 5-0 rout at Moldova on Saturday.

title: Scaloni on Argentina win: No Messi? No problem
content: Argentina coach Lionel Scaloni said Friday's win over Uruguay showed their depth after Lautaro Martínez, Lionel Messi and Paulo Dybala all missed out.

title: Rice hails Lewis-Skelly: Fearless, hungry, asset
content: Myles Lewis-Skelly has already made himself an asset for England and has a long career ahead of him, his teammate Declan Rice said.

title: Leon kicked out of Club World Cup by FIFA
content: Grupo Pachuca confirmed that the FIFA appeals committee on Friday ruled Club León out of participation in the 2025 Club World Cup due to the tournament's multi-ownership rules.

title: It wasn't his behavior, but this Stanford program belongs to Andrew Luck
content: Right now, all of Stanford's trust is in Luck. It's his program now, and that means Troy Taylor is his coach.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Liverpool, Bayern favorites to sign Cherki
content: Rayan Cherki looks set to leave Lyon this summer, with Liverpool and Bayern Munich both interested. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Indian Man, Daughter Killed In US Store Shooting, Left Gujarat 6 Years Back
content: A 24-year-old Indian woman and her 56-year-old father were shot dead at a departmental store in Virginia, US, where they had been working. The shooting took place on Thursday, shortly after the store in Accomack County opened.

title: Supreme Court Makes Report On Judge Cash Row Public, Includes Pics, Videos
content: A report submitted by the Chief Justice of the High Court of Delhi into alleged finding of a cash stash at the house of high court judge Justice Yashwant Varma has been uploaded on the Supreme Court website.

title: Indian-Origin Woman, Seeking Son's Custody, Kills Him On Disneyland Trip
content: Saritha Ramaraju, 48, has been charged with one felony count of murder for slitting her son's throat, killing the boy after they went on a vacation to Disneyland.

title: Indian Techie Detained In Qatar For Over 3 Months On Data Theft Charge
content: BJP MP Hemang Joshi told the media that Amit Gupta, a resident of Vadodara, had been working for Tech Mahindra in Qatar for the past 10 years.

title: "Preposterous, Incredible, Incredulous": Judge On Cash Recovery Claims
content: Strongly denying that he or his family had kept any cash in the storeroom from which the burnt remains of several wads of notes were allegedly recovered, Delhi High Court Justice Yashwant Varma has said the room is disconnected from his residence

title: Father Of Last Living US Hostage In Gaza Hopes Trump Can Bring Him Home
content: Edan Alexander, a 21-year-old Israeli-American soldier who grew up in the US, is one of 59 hostages still in Gaza, more than half of whom are believed to be dead.

title: 'Drank 2 Bottles A Day': Driver On Meerut Murder Accused's Himachal Vacation
content: Muskaan Rastogi and her friend Sahil Shukla regularly purchased alcohol, brought a birthday cake and even visited a gurudwara during their 15-day trip to the hills from March 4, hours after they murdered a former Merchant Navy officer in Meerut.

title: Why Pune Man Regrets Moving To Bengaluru Despite 40% Salary Hike
content: A corporate employee moved from Pune to Bengaluru for a lucrative 40 per cent salary, only to regret his decision within a year. His story was shared by a friend in a now-viral LinkedInpost.

title: Gurugram Cops Slap Rs 1,000 Fine On Drunk Man In Car. He Wasn't Driving
content: A Gurugram man was allegedly fined Rs 1,000 by the police for being drunk inside his own car, despite not being behind the wheel.

title: MS Dhoni Breaks Silence On Future Ahead Of CSK's Season Opener Against MI
content: MS Dhoni quit international cricket in 2020 but has since continued to play for Chennai Super Kings in the IPL.

title: Rs 3,48,69,621 Cash, 32 Gram Gold, 1 Kg Silver Donated At Karnataka Temple
content: A total of Rs 3,48,69,621 in cash, 32 grams of gold and 1.24 kg of silver have been donated at a temple in Karnataka's Raichur.

title: "Wholesome Experience": Delhi Woman Cancels Cab For Female Rapido Captain
content: A Delhi woman's ride with Rapido turned into an unexpectedly "wholesome experience" when she met a female captain who was also a chef.

title: Not Kohli, Rahane Explains What Changed Momentum In RCB's Favour
content: After KKR limped to 174/8, the explosive opening duo of Philip Salt and Virat Kohli set the Eden Gardens ablaze with a searing display with the bat.

title: Teen Boy, Girl Found Hanging From Tree In Delhi Park, Cops Suspect Suicide
content: The boy, aged around 17 years, was dressed in a black T-shirt and blue jeans, while the girl, also approximately of the same age, was wearing a green dress.

title: Mehul Choksi Surfaces In Belgium, India Begins Process To Get Him: Report
content: Fugitive businessman Mehul Choksi is living in Belgium's Antwerp with wife Preeti Choksi, a citizen of Belgium, a report by Associates Times said.

title: All-Star to architect: Buster Posey's plan to rebuild the Giants
content: buster Posey is six days shy of his 38th birthday and less than six months removed from a job few people of his stature have ever taken on . he has a different role: to methodically guide them there, inch by inch, meeting by meeting, transaction by transaction . "as a player, I would come in every day and have a list in my mind of what I wanted to accomplish," he says .

title: Jameis Winston signing sets up Giants' next -- and more significant -- QB move
content: jameis Winston is a notable name with a well-traveled résumé . he could have played his way into a starting job with the New Orleans Saints or Cleveland Browns . the Giants aren't committed to him long term, but they can move on after this season .

title: Men's championship odds: Duke, Florida clear co-favorites
content: The 2025 NCAA men's basketball championship game will be played April 7 at the Alamodome in San Antonio.  Tops seeds  Duke ,  Florida ,  Auburn  and  Houston  are the top favorites while two-time defending champions  UConn  are 125-1 to three-peat. The initial 68-team field was announced Sunday March 16 and has now narrowed to 32 teams through the first round of the tournament. Second round: March 22 and 23 Sweet 16: March 27 and 28 Elite Eight: March 29 and 30 Final Four: April 5 Championship game: April 7 Here are odds for each school to win the men's college basketball championship, along with their odds to reach the Sweet 16, Elite Eight, Final Four and the championship game. Odds are accurate as of publication time.  For the latest odds, go to  ESPN BET .

title: USMNT loses to Panama again in worst performance of Pochettino era
content: Mauricio Pochettino and the united states men's national team lose 1-0 to Panama . the defeat ends the USMNT's run of three consecutive wins in the Concacaf Nations League . it's the third straight time Panama had defeated the U.S. in tournament play .

title: Karuthal sports fete for the elderly begins
content: e-Paper The Hindu On Books Books of the week, reviews, excerpts, new titles and features . health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective .

title: Indian-origin man, 24-yr-old daughter shot dead in US store; suspect arrested
content: A tragic shooting in Virginia claimed the lives of Pradeep Patel and his daughter Urmi, causing shockwaves in both the Gujarati community in the US and their native village in Mehsana. Pradeep, 56, died on the spot while Urmi succumbed to injuries two days later; the suspected shooter has been arrested.

title: INDIA must appear to be a ‘bloc and not un-bloc' itself in public domain: Kapil Sibal
content: Rajya Sabha MP Kapil Sibal urged the INDIA alliance to present a united front with a formal structure and clear spokespersons. Highlighting internal conflicts, he emphasized the necessity for a cohesive policy approach to effectively counter the BJP. Sibal also discussed potential challenges and political implications related to upcoming issues like the Waqf (Amendment) Bill and delimitation.

title: Saurabh murder case: Muskan, her lover grappling with 'drug withdrawal symptoms’
content: Incarcerated for the murder of her husband, Muskan Rastogi and her lover Sahil Shukla, both battling severe drug withdrawal symptoms, are closely monitored in Meerut jail. Their request to stay near each other was denied. Police investigations reveal their long-term drug use and possible obsession with black magic. Efforts are on for a fast-track trial.

title: 'His tutor should be changed': BJP takes a dig at Rahul over 'merit' remark
content: BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad criticizes Rahul Gandhi for questioning India's merit system and doubts Gandhi's own qualifications for his role as the leader of the opposition. Gandhi's remarks highlighted the biases in India’s education and bureaucratic systems against Dalits, OBCs, and tribals.

title: ‘Wife watched husband live for 44 min’: Man livestreams suicide in MP
content: A 27-year-old man from Rewa district died by suicide while live-streaming his final moments on social media, accusing his wife and mother-in-law of driving him to the act. The police have arrested the wife's mother and the wife for abetment to suicide after discovering the wife's involvement.

title: 'Close all Zerodha accounts ...': Customer message that got CEO into action
content: Sachin Jha was compelled to close his Zerodha account due to a compliance issue when his wife joined a global investment bank. Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath responded promptly, addressing the trust gap with an action plan, although Jha ultimately closed his account.

title: ‘Effects of antipathy’: Is US seeing a drop in tourist arrivals?
content: US tourism faces a decline, with international visitors projected to drop by 5.1% in 2025. Factors include policies by President Trump, a strong dollar, and rising global tensions. The tourism sector risks losing $64 billion as a consequence, impacting major upcoming events.

title: ‘No proof of forced entry’: Key details from Delhi HC CJ’s report on judge cash row
content: The Supreme Court has initiated an inquiry into the fire at Justice Yashwant Varma's residence, where burnt currency notes were allegedly found. Justice Varma denies any wrongdoing, calling the allegations a conspiracy. A three-member panel will investigate the case and review forensic findings.

title: IPL 2025: Irfan Pathan's commentary role cut over player bias?
content: Irfan Pathan has been excluded from this season’s IPL commentary panel over allegations of bias against certain players. The former cricketer has previously had conflicts that influenced his commentary and social media posts. Pathan has now launched his YouTube channel.

title: LinkedIn cofounder says ‘one of the problems’ with Trump administration is…
content: Reid Hoffman, LinkedIn cofounder, warns that the US's strained diplomacy could disadvantage American businesses, particularly in the tech sector. He emphasizes the importance of maintaining alliances to prevent international competitors from gaining an edge, despite current administration strategies that might alienate traditional partners.

title: Indian techie detained in Qatar without charges for over 3 months, kin seek PMO’s help
content: A Vadodara family has sought the PMO's intervention for their son's release in Qatar, where he has been held in solitary confinement since January 1 without any charges. Amit Gupta, working for an Indian multinational company, was detained after dining out, leaving his family in distress.

title: Why this village in Karnataka a red flag for brides-to-be
content: Jondalagatti village in Haveri district, known as the 'Village of Bachelors,' faces issues with infrastructure, healthcare, and communication that discourage prospective brides. Consequently, the village is seeing a decline in new school enrollments due to the lack of children.

title: 17-year-old boy, girl found hanging in Delhi's Deer Park
content: A 17-year-old boy and girl were discovered hanging from a tree in Deer Park, Delhi on March 23, suggesting a suspected suicide pact. The incident was reported by a security guard. Police launched an investigation, and the bodies were sent for examination. The area, known for its restaurants and shops, is being further scrutinized.

title: More than 400 Hollywood celebrities send complaint letter against Google, OpenAI
content: Over 400 Hollywood celebrities, including Ben Stiller and Paul McCartney, have signed an open letter to the Trump administration opposing efforts to weaken copyright protections for AI training. They argue such changes would harm the creative industry, which supports millions of American jobs and significant economic contributions.

title: David Warner hits out at Air India: 'No pilots, waiting for hours'
content: Ex-Australia cricketer David Warner expressed frustration on Saturday about boarding an Air India flight without pilots, leading to hours of delay. The airline attributed the issue to weather-related disruptions at Bengaluru airport, which delayed the flight crew. Air India apologised for the inconvenience, explaining that crew delays affected the flight's departure.

title: Indian-origin woman charged with murdering son after Disneyland trip
content: Saritha Ramaraju, 48, has been charged with murder after allegedly killing her 11-year-old son during a custody visit in California. The incident occurred after a trip to Disneyland, with the child found deceased in their hotel room. Additional charges include using a knife. If convicted, she faces 26 years to life in prison.

title: 65-yr-old man stabbed to death as 2 families clash in Delhi
content: A 65-year-old man was stabbed to death while trying to break up a fight between two families in northwest Delhi's Bharat Nagar. The altercation, which began as a minor dispute between children, escalated into violence, resulting in multiple injuries and extensive property damage. Police are investigating the case.

title: WATCH: Kohli fan breaches security to touch RCB star's feet
content: In the IPL 2025 opener, Virat Kohli led Royal Challengers Bengaluru to a commanding win over Kolkata Knight Riders, scoring an unbeaten 59. Chasing down 175 in just 16.2 overs, RCB started strong with a 95-run opening partnership between Kohli and Phil Salt. Despite mid-innings stumbles, RCB secured victory with 22 balls to spare.

title: IPL 2025 live stream: Where & how to watch SRH vs RR match online & on TV
content: Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) begin their IPL campaign against Rajasthan Royals (RR) at Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium. With explosive hitters like Travis Head and Abhishek Sharma, SRH have the potential to set high scores. The match will be captained by Pat Cummins, with SRH’s experienced bowling led by Mohammed Shami, contrasting with an underwhelming RR missing their captain Sanju Samson.

title: Cleaning up Yamuna act: Delhi may ban use of soaps, detergents in car washes
content: Delhi government plans to ban soaps and detergents in car washes to reduce the phosphates and surfactants entering the Yamuna. A campaign will raise public awareness, and car-wash centers near sewage treatment plants might be set up to use treated wastewater. This initiative aims to tackle the toxic froth and pollution choking the river.

title: I salute Rhea Chakraborty for silent strength: Maneshinde on Sushant case closure
content: The CBI has submitted a closure report on Bollywood actor Sushant Singh Rajput's death, ruling out foul play. The report, filed after four and a half years, comes amidst a backdrop of intense media scrutiny and false narratives. Rhea Chakraborty and her family faced significant hardships but were ultimately cleared of wrongdoing.

title: Fugitive businessman Mehul Choksi living in Belgium: Report
content: Fugitive businessman Mehul Choksi, accused of defrauding Punjab National Bank, is living in Belgium after securing residency. Indian authorities are seeking his extradition. Choksi left India in 2018 and his whereabouts have frequently changed, previously residing in Antigua and Dominica before moving to Belgium.

title: Muslim body declines Bihar CM Nitish Kumar’s Iftaar invitation over Waqf bill
content: Imarat Shariah, a major Muslim organisation in Bihar, has refused Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's Iftaar invitation, protesting his support for the Waqf Bill. They allege the bill will harm Muslims’ economic and educational status. Accusing Kumar of betraying his secular promises, the group deems his actions as tokenism. JD(U) has yet to respond.

title: Israel launches airstrikes on Lebanon in largest attack since ceasefire
content: Israel launched airstrikes on multiple locations in Lebanon, killing at least six people in retaliation for a rocket attack. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu ordered strikes on Hezbollah targets, raising concerns about the fragile ceasefire. Hezbollah denied responsibility for the attack, and Lebanese leadership stressed they do not seek a return to war.

title: Krunal Pandya's triple strike turns the tide as RCB crush KKR in IPL opener
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) launched their IPL 2025 campaign with a seven-wicket victory against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) at Eden Gardens. RCB, led by Rajat Patidar, chased down 175 runs with standout performances from Phil Salt (56) and Virat Kohli (59 not out). Krunal Pandya's three-wicket haul crippled KKR, who managed 174/8 in their 20 overs.

title: Protesting farmers dare Punjab government, refuse to seek bail
content: Leaders of Kisan Mazdoor Morcha and Sanyukt Kisan Morcha (Non-Political) have opted not to file bail applications, challenging the Punjab government's commitment to detain them. Despite their arrests, leaders remain determined to continue their protest. Missing valuables and unjust treatment have added to their grievances, and farmer organizations vow to mobilize people for future demonstrations.

title: George Foreman death: NFL stars Brett Favre, Russell Wilson, and more mourn
content: George Foreman, the two-time world heavyweight boxing champion and Olympic gold medalist, passed away on March 21, 2025, at the age of 76. Known for his incredible punching power and remarkable comeback, Foreman's legacy extends beyond boxing as an entrepreneur and devout preacher, inspiring many with his perseverance and reinvention.

title: Pawar ‘peeps into’ room as Ajit, Jayant hold closed-door meeting
content: Jayant Patil met NCP chief Ajit Pawar for a closed-door discussion at the VSI, which was attended by Sharad Pawar. Ajit Pawar downplayed speculations about Patil quitting his party, stating that their meeting was focused on discussing the implementation of artificial intelligence in agriculture.

title: Salman Khan, Maharastra Deputy CM Shinde attend sports event in Mumbai
content: A friendly cricket match titled 'Neta XI Vs Abhineta XI' was held in Mumbai to raise awareness about tuberculosis. The game was attended by Bollywood stars including Salman Khan and political figures such as Maharashtra Deputy CM Eknath Shinde. The match was organized by former Union Sports Minister Anurag Thakur.

title: Will continue action against illegal madrassas, says Dhami
content: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami outlines measures against illegal madrassas, traffic management for the Doon-Delhi expressway, and job creation to curb migration. He highlights the implementation of the Uniform Civil Code and successful hosting of the National Games as key achievements. Disaster response and Char Dham yatra planning are also detailed.

title: Proposed panel will be final authority on delimitation: FM
content: Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman emphasized that the Delimitation Commission will determine the criteria for delimitation, not based solely on population. She addressed concerns regarding the potential impact on southern states, criticized the DMK for distraction tactics, and clarified misconceptions around the National Education Policy.

title: 21 Hakkipikki tribals detained in Gabon over alleged fake visa
content: Authorities in Libreville, Gabon, detained 21 Karnataka residents holding fake business visas while trading goods. The group, comprising members of the Hakkipikki community, faces penalties but is arranging funds for their release and return to India with the support of their families and the Indian Embassy.

title: ED acts against judge in Rs 50cr payout scam, seizes 24 assets
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) attached 24 properties linked to accused former railway claims tribunal judge R K Mittal in a Rs 50 crore fraud case. The agency has previously acted against judges involved in bribery and fraud, highlighting the case of former Panchkula judge Sudhir Parmar and alleged liaisoning in the Chhattisgarh PDS scam.

title: 'I had a dream': Education a casualty as camp kids stare at uncertainty
content: The ethnic conflict in Manipur has displaced thousands and disrupted children's education. Relief camps are overflowing with young minds whose dreams have been interrupted. As families struggle for survival, the future of an entire generation hangs in the balance, with urgent government intervention needed.
